items.description: Upper River Derwent, Stonethwaite Beck and Derwent Water
items.message:
River levels are continuing to fall steadily, but remain high on the Upper River Derwent, Stonethwaite Beck and Derwent Water due to recent heavy rainfall and will remain so for several days.
Areas most at risk include The Upper Derwent from Seathwaite to Derwent Water. River levels also remain high at the Keswick Campsite; Lodore gauge.
We will continue to monitor levels closely.
Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses and do not attempt to walk or drive through flood water.
This message will be updated by 9:00am on 25/09/2023, or as the situation changes.

The Flood Warning has now been removed. However, a Flood Alert remains in force for the wider area, so flooding of roads and low lying land is still possible.
River levels remain high but are beginning to fall.
We will continue to monitor levels closely.
Continue to take care on waterside roads and footpaths and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger.
